newsitem.title: GERMANY: German grain intervention continues at slow pace.
newsitem.headline: German grain intervention continues at slow pace.

text.p: Sales offers into German grain intervention stores in the Nov-May 1996/97 season continued sluggish, data from state intervention board BLE showed on Monday.
Volumes on December 6 totalled 262,074 tonnes compared with 1,040,002 a year earlier.
The figure described volumes accepted, but not yet delivered to stores, by the close last Friday.
Market prices in most regions were steady above intervention buying-in levels although traded volumes were slim as sellers awaited fresh demand early in 1997, traders said.
More than three quarters of total intervention volumes were estimated to have been offered in eastern Germany.
The Dec intervention buying-in price is 234.86 marks.
BLE gave the following breakdown of offers into intervention in tonnes --
